2615 
2616 float ViewProviderSketch::getScaleFactor() const
2617 {
2618  assert(isInEditMode());
2619  Gui::MDIView* mdi =
2620  Gui::Application::Instance->editViewOfNode(editCoinManager->getRootEditNode());
2621  if (mdi && mdi->isDerivedFrom(Gui::View3DInventor::getClassTypeId())) {
2622  Gui::View3DInventorViewer* viewer = static_cast<Gui::View3DInventor*>(mdi)->getViewer();
2623  SoCamera* camera = viewer->getSoRenderManager()->getCamera();
2624  float scale = camera->getViewVolume(camera->aspectRatio.getValue())
2625  .getWorldToScreenScale(SbVec3f(0.f, 0.f, 0.f), 0.1f)
2626  / 3;
2627  return scale;
2628  }
2629  else {
2630  return 1.f;
2631  }
2632 }
2633 
2634 // This function ensures that the geometry used for drawing takes into account:
2635 // 1. the OCC mandated weight, which is normalised for non-rational BSplines, but not normalised for
2636 // rational BSplines. That includes properly sizing for drawing any weight constraint. This function
2637 // ensures that both the geometry of the SketchObject and solver are updated with the new value of
2638 // the scaling factor (via the extension)
2639 // 2. the scaling factor, including inserting the scaling factor into the
2640 // ViewProviderSketchGeometryExtension so as to enable That ensures that dragging operations on the
2641 // circles of the poles of the B-Splines are properly rendered.
2642 //
2643 // This function takes a reference to a vector of deep copies to delete. These deep copies are
2644 // necessary to transparently perform (1) while doing (2).
2645 void ViewProviderSketch::scaleBSplinePoleCirclesAndUpdateSolverAndSketchObjectGeometry(
2646  GeoListFacade& geolistfacade, bool geometrywithmemoryallocation)
2647 {
2648  // In order to allow one to tweak geometry and insert scaling factors, this function needs to
2649  // change the geometry vector. This is highly exceptional for a drawing function and special
2650  // care needs to be taken. This is valid because:
2651  // 1. The treatment is exceptional and no other appropriate place is available to perform this
2652  // tweak
2653  // 2. The original object needs to remain const for the benefit of all other class hierarchy of
2654  // drawing functions
2655  // 3. When referring to actual geometry, the modified pointers are short lived, as they are
2656  // destroyed after drawing
2657  auto& tempGeo = geolistfacade.geomlist;
2658 
2659  int GeoId = 0;
2660  for (auto it = tempGeo.begin(); it != tempGeo.end() - 2; ++it, GeoId++) {
2661  if (GeoId >= geolistfacade.getInternalCount())
2662  GeoId = -geolistfacade.getExternalCount();
2663 
2664  if ((*it)->getGeometry()->is<Part::GeomCircle>()) {// circle
2665  const Part::GeomCircle* circle =
2666  static_cast<const Part::GeomCircle*>((*it)->getGeometry());
2667  auto& gf = (*it);
2668 
2669  // BSpline weights have a radius corresponding to the weight value
2670  // However, in order for them proportional to the B-Spline size,
2671  // the scenograph has a size scalefactor times the weight
2672  //
2673  // This code produces the scaled up version of the geometry for the scenograph
2674  if (gf->getInternalType() == InternalType::BSplineControlPoint) {
2675  for (auto c : getSketchObject()->Constraints.getValues()) {
2676  if (c->Type == InternalAlignment && c->AlignmentType == BSplineControlPoint
2677  && c->First == GeoId) {
2678  auto bspline = dynamic_cast<const Part::GeomBSplineCurve*>(
2679  tempGeo[c->Second]->getGeometry());
2680 
2681  if (bspline) {
2682  auto weights = bspline->getWeights();
2683 
2684  double weight = 1.0;
2685  if (c->InternalAlignmentIndex < int(weights.size()))
2686  weight = weights[c->InternalAlignmentIndex];
2687 
2688  // tentative scaling factor:
2689  // proportional to the length of the bspline
2690  // inversely proportional to the number of poles
2691  double scalefactor = bspline->length(bspline->getFirstParameter(),
2692  bspline->getLastParameter())
2693  / 10.0 / weights.size();
2694 
2695  double vradius = weight * scalefactor;
2696  if (!bspline->isRational()) {
2697  // OCCT sets the weights to 1.0 if a bspline is non-rational, but if
2698  // the user has a weight constraint on any pole it would cause a
2699  // visual artifact of having a constraint with a different radius
2700  // and an unscaled circle so better scale the circles.
2701  std::vector<int> polegeoids;
2702  polegeoids.reserve(weights.size());
2703 
2704  for (auto ic : getSketchObject()->Constraints.getValues()) {
2705  if (ic->Type == InternalAlignment
2706  && ic->AlignmentType == BSplineControlPoint
2707  && ic->Second == c->Second) {
2708  polegeoids.push_back(ic->First);
2709  }
2710  }
2711 
2712  for (auto ic : getSketchObject()->Constraints.getValues()) {
2713  if (ic->Type == Weight) {
2714  auto pos = std::find(
2715  polegeoids.begin(), polegeoids.end(), ic->First);
2716 
2717  if (pos != polegeoids.end()) {
2718  vradius = ic->getValue() * scalefactor;
2719  break;// one is enough, otherwise it would not be
2720  // non-rational
2721  }
2722  }
2723  }
2724  }
2725 
2726  Part::GeomCircle* tmpcircle;
2727 
2728  if (geometrywithmemoryallocation) {// with memory allocation
2729  tmpcircle = const_cast<Part::GeomCircle*>(circle);
2730  tmpcircle->setRadius(vradius);
2731  }
2732  else {// without memory allocation
2733  tmpcircle = static_cast<Part::GeomCircle*>(circle->clone());
2734  tmpcircle->setRadius(vradius);
2735  tempGeo[GeoId] = GeometryFacade::getFacade(
2736  tmpcircle, true);// this is the circle that will be drawn, with
2737  // the updated vradius, the facade takes
2738  // ownership and will deallocate.
2739  }
2740 
2741  if (!circle->hasExtension(
2742  SketcherGui::ViewProviderSketchGeometryExtension::
2743  getClassTypeId())) {
2744  // It is ok to add this kind of extension to a const geometry
2745  // because:
2746  // 1. It does not modify the object in a way that affects property
2747  // state, just ViewProvider representation
2748  // 2. If it is lost (for example upon undo), redrawing will
2749  // reinstate it with the correct value
2750  const_cast<Part::GeomCircle*>(circle)->setExtension(
2751  std::make_unique<
2752  SketcherGui::ViewProviderSketchGeometryExtension>());
2753  }
2754 
2755  auto vpext = std::const_pointer_cast<
2756  SketcherGui::ViewProviderSketchGeometryExtension>(
2757  std::static_pointer_cast<
2758  const SketcherGui::ViewProviderSketchGeometryExtension>(
2759  circle
2760  ->getExtension(
2761  SketcherGui::ViewProviderSketchGeometryExtension::
2762  getClassTypeId())
2763  .lock()));
2764 
2765  vpext->setRepresentationFactor(scalefactor);
2766 
2767  // save scale factor for any prospective dragging operation
2768  // 1. Solver must be updated, in case a dragging operation starts
2769  // 2. if temp geometry is being used (with memory allocation), then the
2770  // copy we have here must be updated. If
2771  // no temp geometry is being used, then the normal geometry must be
2772  // updated.
2773  // make solver be ready for a dragging operation
2774  auto solverext = vpext->copy();
2775 
2776  getSketchObject()->updateSolverExtension(GeoId, std::move(solverext));
2777  }
2778  break;
2779  }
2780  }
2781  }
2782  }
2783  }
2784 }
2785 
2786 void ViewProviderSketch::draw(bool temp /*=false*/, bool rebuildinformationoverlay /*=true*/)
2787 {
2788  assert(isInEditMode());
2789 
2790  // ============== Retrieve geometry to be represented =================================
2791 
2792  auto geolistfacade = temp ? getSolvedSketch().extractGeoListFacade() :// with memory allocation
2793  getSketchObject()->getGeoListFacade();// without memory allocation
2794 
2795  assert(int(geolistfacade.geomlist.size()) >= 2);
2796 
2797  // ============== Prepare geometry for representation ==================================
2798 
2799  // ************ Manage BSpline pole circle scaling ****************************
2800 
2801  // This function ensures that the geometry used for drawing takes into account:
2802  // 1. the OCC mandated weight, which is normalised for non-rational BSplines, but not normalised
2803  // for rational BSplines. That includes properly sizing for drawing any weight constraint. This
2804  // function ensures that both the geometry of the SketchObject and solver are updated with the
2805  // new value of the scaling factor (via the extension)
2806  // 2. the scaling factor, including inserting the scaling factor into the
2807  // ViewProviderSketchGeometryExtension so as to enable That ensures that dragging operations on
2808  // the circles of the poles of the B-Splines are properly rendered.
2809  //
2810  // This function takes a reference to a vector of deep copies to delete. These deep copies are
2811  // necessary to transparently perform (1) while doing (2).
2812 
2813  scaleBSplinePoleCirclesAndUpdateSolverAndSketchObjectGeometry(geolistfacade, temp);
2814 
2815  // ============== Render geometry, constraints and geometry information overlays
2816  // ==================================
2817 
2818  editCoinManager->processGeometryConstraintsInformationOverlay(geolistfacade,
2819  rebuildinformationoverlay);
2820 
2821  // Avoids unneeded calls to pixmapFromSvg
2822  if (Mode == STATUS_NONE || Mode == STATUS_SKETCH_UseHandler) {
2823  editCoinManager->drawConstraintIcons(geolistfacade);
2824  editCoinManager->updateColor(geolistfacade);
2825  }
2826 
2827  Gui::MDIView* mdi = this->getActiveView();
2828  if (mdi && mdi->isDerivedFrom(Gui::View3DInventor::getClassTypeId())) {
2829  static_cast<Gui::View3DInventor*>(mdi)->getViewer()->redraw();
2830  }
2831 }

2871 void ViewProviderSketch::slotSolverUpdate()
2872 {
2873  if (!isInEditMode() )
2874  return;
2875 
2876  // At this point, we do not need to solve the Sketch
2877  // If we are adding geometry an update can be triggered before the sketch is actually
2878  // solved. Because a solve is mandatory to any addition (at least to update the DoF of the
2879  // solver), only when the solver geometry is the same in number than the sketch geometry an
2880  // update should trigger a redraw. This reduces even more the number of redraws per
2881  // insertion of geometry
2882 
2883  // solver information is also updated when no matching geometry, so that if a solving fails
2884  // this failed solving info is presented to the user
2885  UpdateSolverInformation();// just update the solver window with the last SketchObject
2886  // solving information
2887 
2888  if (getSketchObject()->getExternalGeometryCount()
2889  + getSketchObject()->getHighestCurveIndex() + 1
2890  == getSolvedSketch().getGeometrySize()) {
2891  Gui::MDIView* mdi = Gui::Application::Instance->editDocument()->getActiveView();
2892  if (mdi->isDerivedFrom(Gui::View3DInventor::getClassTypeId()))
2893  draw(false, true);
2894 
2895  signalConstraintsChanged();
2896  }
2897 }

2899 void ViewProviderSketch::onChanged(const App::Property* prop)
2900 {
2901  if (prop == &VisualLayerList) {
2902  if (isInEditMode()) {
2903  // Configure and rebuild Coin SceneGraph
2904  editCoinManager->updateGeometryLayersConfiguration();
2905  }
2906  return;
2907  }
2908 
2909  if (prop == &AutoColor) {
2910  auto usesAutomaticColors = AutoColor.getValue();
2911 
2912  // when auto color is enabled don't save color information in the document
2913  // so it does not cause unnecessary updates if multiple users use different colors
2914  LineColor.setStatus(App::Property::Transient, usesAutomaticColors);
2915  PointColor.setStatus(App::Property::Transient, usesAutomaticColors);
2916 
2917  // and mark this property as read-only hidden so it's not possible to change manually
2918  LineColor.setStatus(App::Property::ReadOnly, usesAutomaticColors);
2919  LineColor.setStatus(App::Property::Hidden, usesAutomaticColors);
2920  PointColor.setStatus(App::Property::ReadOnly, usesAutomaticColors);
2921  PointColor.setStatus(App::Property::Hidden, usesAutomaticColors);
2922 
2923  return;
2924  }
2925 
2926  // call father
2927  ViewProviderPart::onChanged(prop);
2928 }

2973 bool ViewProviderSketch::setEdit(int ModNum)
2974 {
2975  Q_UNUSED(ModNum)
2976  // When double-clicking on the item for this sketch the
2977  // object unsets and sets its edit mode without closing
2978  // the task panel
2979  Gui::TaskView::TaskDialog* dlg = Gui::Control().activeDialog();
2980  TaskDlgEditSketch* sketchDlg = qobject_cast<TaskDlgEditSketch*>(dlg);
2981  if (sketchDlg && sketchDlg->getSketchView() != this)
2982  sketchDlg = nullptr;// another sketch left open its task panel
2983  if (dlg && !sketchDlg) {
2984  QMessageBox msgBox;
2985  msgBox.setText(tr("A dialog is already open in the task panel"));
2986  msgBox.setInformativeText(tr("Do you want to close this dialog?"));
2987  msgBox.setStandardButtons(QMessageBox::Yes | QMessageBox::No);
2988  msgBox.setDefaultButton(QMessageBox::Yes);
2989  int ret = msgBox.exec();
2990  if (ret == QMessageBox::Yes)
2991  Gui::Control().closeDialog();
2992  else
2993  return false;
2994  }
2995 
2996  Sketcher::SketchObject* sketch = getSketchObject();
2997 
2998  if(sketch->isFreezed()) {
2999  return false; // Disallow edit of a frozen sketch
3000  }
3001 
3002  if (!sketch->evaluateConstraints()) {
3003  QMessageBox box(Gui::getMainWindow());
3004  box.setIcon(QMessageBox::Critical);
3005  box.setWindowTitle(tr("Invalid sketch"));
3006  box.setText(tr("Do you want to open the sketch validation tool?"));
3007  box.setInformativeText(tr("The sketch is invalid and cannot be edited."));
3008  box.setStandardButtons(QMessageBox::Yes | QMessageBox::No);
3009  box.setDefaultButton(QMessageBox::Yes);
3010  switch (box.exec()) {
3011  case QMessageBox::Yes:
3012  Gui::Control().showDialog(new TaskSketcherValidation(getSketchObject()));
3013  break;
3014  default:
3015  break;
3016  }
3017  return false;
3018  }
3019 
3020  // clear the selection (convenience)
3021  Gui::Selection().clearSelection();
3022  Gui::Selection().rmvPreselect();
3023 
3024  this->attachSelection();
3025 
3026  auto gridnode = getGridNode();
3027  Base::Placement plm = getEditingPlacement();
3028  setGridOrientation(plm.getPosition(), plm.getRotation());
3029  addNodeToRoot(gridnode);
3030  setGridEnabled(true);
3031 
3032  // create the container for the additional edit data
3033  assert(!isInEditMode());
3034  preselection.reset();
3035  selection.reset();
3036  editCoinManager = std::make_unique<EditModeCoinManager>(*this);
3037  snapManager = std::make_unique<SnapManager>(*this);
3038 
3039  auto editDoc = Gui::Application::Instance->editDocument();
3040  App::DocumentObject* editObj = getSketchObject();
3041  std::string editSubName;
3042  ViewProviderDocumentObject* editVp = nullptr;
3043  if (editDoc) {
3044  editDoc->getInEdit(&editVp, &editSubName);
3045  if (editVp)
3046  editObj = editVp->getObject();
3047  }
3048 
3049  // visibility automation
3050  try {
3051  Gui::Command::addModule(Gui::Command::Gui, "Show");
3052  try {
3053  QString cmdstr =
3054  QString::fromLatin1(
3055  "ActiveSketch = App.getDocument('%1').getObject('%2')\n"
3056  "tv = Show.TempoVis(App.ActiveDocument, tag= ActiveSketch.ViewObject.TypeId)\n"
3057  "ActiveSketch.ViewObject.TempoVis = tv\n"
3058  "if ActiveSketch.ViewObject.EditingWorkbench:\n"
3059  " tv.activateWorkbench(ActiveSketch.ViewObject.EditingWorkbench)\n"
3060  "if ActiveSketch.ViewObject.HideDependent:\n"
3061  " tv.hide(tv.get_all_dependent(%3, '%4'))\n"
3062  "if ActiveSketch.ViewObject.ShowSupport:\n"
3063  " tv.show([ref[0] for ref in ActiveSketch.AttachmentSupport if not "
3064  "ref[0].isDerivedFrom(\"PartDesign::Plane\")])\n"
3065  "if ActiveSketch.ViewObject.ShowLinks:\n"
3066  " tv.show([ref[0] for ref in ActiveSketch.ExternalGeometry])\n"
3067  "tv.sketchClipPlane(ActiveSketch, ActiveSketch.ViewObject.SectionView)\n"
3068  "tv.hide(ActiveSketch)\n"
3069  "del(tv)\n"
3070  "del(ActiveSketch)\n")
3071  .arg(QString::fromLatin1(getDocument()->getDocument()->getName()),
3072  QString::fromLatin1(getSketchObject()->getNameInDocument()),
3073  QString::fromLatin1(Gui::Command::getObjectCmd(editObj).c_str()),
3074  QString::fromLatin1(editSubName.c_str()));
3075  QByteArray cmdstr_bytearray = cmdstr.toLatin1();
3076  Gui::Command::runCommand(Gui::Command::Gui, cmdstr_bytearray);
3077  }
3078  catch (Base::PyException& e) {
3079  Base::Console().DeveloperError(
3080  "ViewProviderSketch", "setEdit: visibility automation failed with an error: \n");
3081  e.ReportException();
3082  }
3083  }
3084  catch (Base::PyException&) {
3085  Base::Console().DeveloperWarning(
3086  "ViewProviderSketch",
3087  "setEdit: could not import Show module. Visibility automation will not work.\n");
3088  }
3089 
3090  // start the edit dialog
3091  if (!sketchDlg)
3092  sketchDlg = new TaskDlgEditSketch(this);
3093 
3094  connectionToolWidget = sketchDlg->registerToolWidgetChanged(std::bind(&SketcherGui::ViewProviderSketch::slotToolWidgetChanged, this, sp::_1));
3095 
3096  Gui::Control().showDialog(sketchDlg);
3097 
3098  // This call to the solver is needed to initialize the DoF and solve time controls
3099  // The false parameter indicates that the geometry of the SketchObject shall not be updateData
3100  // so as not to trigger an onChanged that would set the document as modified and trigger a
3101  // recompute if we just close the sketch without touching anything.
3102  if (getSketchObject()->AttachmentSupport.getValue()) {
3103  if (!getSketchObject()->evaluateSupport())
3104  getSketchObject()->validateExternalLinks();
3105  }
3106 
3107  //NOLINTBEGIN
3108  connectUndoDocument = getDocument()->signalUndoDocument.connect(
3109  std::bind(&ViewProviderSketch::slotUndoDocument, this, sp::_1));
3110  connectRedoDocument = getDocument()->signalRedoDocument.connect(
3111  std::bind(&ViewProviderSketch::slotRedoDocument, this, sp::_1));
3112  connectSolverUpdate = getSketchObject()
3113  ->signalSolverUpdate.connect(boost::bind(&ViewProviderSketch::slotSolverUpdate, this));
3114  //NOLINTEND
3115 
3116  // There are geometry extensions introduced by the solver and geometry extensions introduced by
3117  // the viewprovider.
3118  // 1. It is important that the solver has geometry with updated extensions.
3119  // 2. It is important that the viewprovider has up-to-date solver information
3120  //
3121  // The decision is to maintain the "first solve then draw" order, which is consistent with the
3122  // rest of the Sketcher for example in geometry creation. Then, the ViewProvider is responsible
3123  // for updating the solver geometry when appropriate, as it is the ViewProvider that is
3124  // introducing its geometry extensions.
3125  //
3126  // In order to have updated solver information, solve must take "true", this cause the Geometry
3127  // property to be updated with the solver information, including solver extensions, and triggers
3128  // a draw(true) via ViewProvider::UpdateData.
3129  getSketchObject()->solve(true);
3130 
3131  // Enable solver initial solution update while dragging.
3132  getSketchObject()->setRecalculateInitialSolutionWhileMovingPoint(
3133  viewProviderParameters.recalculateInitialSolutionWhileDragging);
3134 
3135  // intercept del key press from main app
3136  listener = new ShortcutListener(this);
3137 
3138  Gui::getMainWindow()->installEventFilter(listener);
3139 
3140  Workbench::enterEditMode();
3141 
3142  // Give focus to the MDI so that keyboard events are caught after starting edit.
3143  // Else pressing ESC right after starting edit will not be caught to exit edit mode.
3144  ensureFocus();
3145 
3146  return true;
3147 }

3177 QString ViewProviderSketch::appendConstraintMsg(const QString& singularmsg,
3178  const QString& pluralmsg,
3179  const std::vector<int>& vector)
3180 {
3181  QString msg;
3182  QTextStream ss(&msg);
3183  if (!vector.empty()) {
3184  if (vector.size() == 1)
3185  ss << singularmsg;
3186  else
3187  ss << pluralmsg;
3188  ss << "\n";
3189  ss << vector[0];
3190  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < vector.size(); i++)
3191  ss << ", " << vector[i];
3192 
3193  ss << "\n";
3194  }

3197 
3198 inline QString intListHelper(const std::vector<int>& ints)
3199 {
3200  QString results;
3201  if (ints.size() < 8) {// The 8 is a bit heuristic... more than that and we shift formats
3202  for (const auto i : ints) {
3203  if (results.isEmpty())
3204  results.append(QString::fromUtf8("%1").arg(i));
3205  else
3206  results.append(QString::fromUtf8(", %1").arg(i));
3207  }
3208  }
3209  else {
3210  const int numToShow = 3;
3211  int more = ints.size() - numToShow;
3212  for (int i = 0; i < numToShow; ++i) {
3213  results.append(QString::fromUtf8("%1, ").arg(ints[i]));
3214  }
3215  results.append(QCoreApplication::translate("ViewProviderSketch", "and %1 more").arg(more));
3216  }
3217  std::string testString = results.toStdString();
3218  return results;
3219 }

3221 void ViewProviderSketch::UpdateSolverInformation()
3222 {
3223  // Updates Solver Information with the Last solver execution at SketchObject level
3224  int dofs = getSketchObject()->getLastDoF();
3225  bool hasConflicts = getSketchObject()->getLastHasConflicts();
3226  bool hasRedundancies = getSketchObject()->getLastHasRedundancies();
3227  bool hasPartiallyRedundant = getSketchObject()->getLastHasPartialRedundancies();
3228  bool hasMalformed = getSketchObject()->getLastHasMalformedConstraints();
3229 
3230  if (getSketchObject()->Geometry.getSize() == 0) {
3231  signalSetUp(QString::fromUtf8("empty_sketch"), tr("Empty sketch"), QString(), QString());
3232  }
3233  else if (dofs < 0 || hasConflicts) {// over-constrained sketch
3234  signalSetUp(
3235  QString::fromUtf8("conflicting_constraints"),
3236  tr("Over-constrained:") + QLatin1String(" "),
3237  QString::fromUtf8("#conflicting"),
3238  QString::fromUtf8("(%1)").arg(intListHelper(getSketchObject()->getLastConflicting())));
3239  }
3240  else if (hasMalformed) {// malformed constraints
3241  signalSetUp(QString::fromUtf8("malformed_constraints"),
3242  tr("Malformed constraints:") + QLatin1String(" "),
3243  QString::fromUtf8("#malformed"),
3244  QString::fromUtf8("(%1)").arg(
3245  intListHelper(getSketchObject()->getLastMalformedConstraints())));
3246  }
3247  else if (hasRedundancies) {
3248  signalSetUp(
3249  QString::fromUtf8("redundant_constraints"),
3250  tr("Redundant constraints:") + QLatin1String(" "),
3251  QString::fromUtf8("#redundant"),
3252  QString::fromUtf8("(%1)").arg(intListHelper(getSketchObject()->getLastRedundant())));
3253  }
3254  else if (hasPartiallyRedundant) {
3255  signalSetUp(QString::fromUtf8("partially_redundant_constraints"),
3256  tr("Partially redundant:") + QLatin1String(" "),
3257  QString::fromUtf8("#partiallyredundant"),
3258  QString::fromUtf8("(%1)").arg(
3259  intListHelper(getSketchObject()->getLastPartiallyRedundant())));
3260  }
3261  else if (getSketchObject()->getLastSolverStatus() != 0) {
3262  signalSetUp(QString::fromUtf8("solver_failed"),
3263  tr("Solver failed to converge"),
3264  QString::fromUtf8(""),
3265  QString::fromUtf8(""));
3266  }
3267  else if (dofs > 0) {
3268  signalSetUp(QString::fromUtf8("under_constrained"),
3269  tr("Under-constrained:") + QLatin1String(" "),
3270  QString::fromUtf8("#dofs"),
3271  tr("%n DoF(s)", "", dofs));
3272  }
3273  else {
3274  signalSetUp(
3275  QString::fromUtf8("fully_constrained"), tr("Fully constrained"), QString(), QString());
3276  }
3277 }

3373 void ViewProviderSketch::setEditViewer(Gui::View3DInventorViewer* viewer, int ModNum)
3374 {
3375  Q_UNUSED(ModNum);
3376  Base::PyGILStateLocker lock;
3377  // visibility automation: save camera
3378  if (!this->TempoVis.getValue().isNone()) {
3379  try {
3380  QString cmdstr =
3381  QString::fromLatin1(
3382  "ActiveSketch = App.getDocument('%1').getObject('%2')\n"
3383  "if ActiveSketch.ViewObject.RestoreCamera:\n"
3384  " ActiveSketch.ViewObject.TempoVis.saveCamera()\n"
3385  " if ActiveSketch.ViewObject.ForceOrtho:\n"
3386  " "
3387  "ActiveSketch.ViewObject.Document.ActiveView.setCameraType('Orthographic')\n")
3388  .arg(QString::fromLatin1(getDocument()->getDocument()->getName()),
3389  QString::fromLatin1(getSketchObject()->getNameInDocument()));

3392  }
3393  catch (Base::PyException& e) {
3394  Base::Console().DeveloperError(
3395  "ViewProviderSketch",
3396  "setEdit: visibility automation failed with an error: %s \n",
3397  e.what());
3398  }
3399  }
3400 
3401  // Sets the view mode to no shading to prevent visibility issues against parallel surfaces with shininess when entering the sketch mode.
3402  ParameterGrp::handle hGrp = App::GetApplication().GetParameterGroupByPath(
3403  "User parameter:BaseApp/Preferences/Mod/Sketcher/General");
3404  auto disableShadedView = hGrp->GetBool("DisableShadedView", true);
3405 
3406  hGrp = App::GetApplication().GetParameterGroupByPath(
3407  "User parameter:BaseApp/Preferences/Mod/Sketcher/General");
3408  hGrp->SetASCII("OverrideMode", viewer->getOverrideMode());
3409 
3410  if (disableShadedView) {
3411 
3412 
3413  viewer->updateOverrideMode("No Shading");
3414  viewer->setOverrideMode("No Shading");
3415 
3416  }
3417 
3418 
3419  auto editDoc = Gui::Application::Instance->editDocument();
3420  editDocName.clear();
3421  if (editDoc) {
3422  ViewProviderDocumentObject* parent = nullptr;
3423  editDoc->getInEdit(&parent, &editSubName);
3424  if (parent) {
3425  editDocName = editDoc->getDocument()->getName();
3426  editObjName = parent->getObject()->getNameInDocument();
3427  }
3428  }
3429  if (editDocName.empty()) {
3430  editDocName = getObject()->getDocument()->getName();
3431  editObjName = getObject()->getNameInDocument();
3432  editSubName.clear();
3433  }
3434  const char* dot = strrchr(editSubName.c_str(), '.');
3435  if (!dot)
3436  editSubName.clear();
3437  else
3438  editSubName.resize(dot - editSubName.c_str() + 1);
3439 
3440  Base::Placement plm = getEditingPlacement();
3441  Base::Rotation tmp(plm.getRotation());
3442 
3443  SbRotation rot((float)tmp[0], (float)tmp[1], (float)tmp[2], (float)tmp[3]);
3444 
3445  // Will the sketch be visible from the new position (#0000957)?
3446  //
3447  SoCamera* camera = viewer->getSoRenderManager()->getCamera();
3448  SbVec3f curdir;// current view direction
3449  camera->orientation.getValue().multVec(SbVec3f(0, 0, -1), curdir);
3450  SbVec3f focal = camera->position.getValue() + camera->focalDistance.getValue() * curdir;
3451 
3452  SbVec3f newdir;// future view direction
3453  rot.multVec(SbVec3f(0, 0, -1), newdir);
3454  SbVec3f newpos = focal - camera->focalDistance.getValue() * newdir;
3455 
3456  SbVec3f plnpos = Base::convertTo<SbVec3f>(plm.getPosition());
3457  double dist = (plnpos - newpos).dot(newdir);
3458  if (dist < 0) {
3459  float focalLength = camera->focalDistance.getValue() - dist + 5;
3460  camera->position = focal - focalLength * curdir;
3461  camera->focalDistance.setValue(focalLength);
3462  }
3463 
3464  viewer->setCameraOrientation(rot);
3465 
3466  viewer->setEditing(true);
3467  viewer->setSelectionEnabled(false);
3468 
3469  viewer->addGraphicsItem(rubberband.get());
3470  rubberband->setViewer(viewer);
3471 
3472  viewer->setupEditingRoot();
3473 
3474  auto *camSensorData = new VPRender {this, viewer->getSoRenderManager()};
3475  cameraSensor.setData(camSensorData);
3476  cameraSensor.setDeleteCallback(&ViewProviderSketch::camSensDeleteCB, camSensorData);
3477  cameraSensor.attach(viewer->getCamera());
3478 }

3493 void ViewProviderSketch::camSensDeleteCB(void* data, SoSensor *s)
3494 {
3495  auto *proxyVPrdr = static_cast<VPRender*>(data);
3496  if (!proxyVPrdr)
3497  return;
3498 
3499  // The camera object the observer was attached to is gone, try to re-attach the sensor
3500  // to the new camera.
3501  // This happens i.e. when the user switches the camera type from orthographic to
3502  // perspective.
3503  SoCamera *camera = proxyVPrdr->renderMgr->getCamera();
3504  if (camera) {
3505  static_cast<SoNodeSensor *>(s)->attach(camera);
3506  }
3507 }

3509 void ViewProviderSketch::camSensCB(void* data, SoSensor*)
3510 {
3511  VPRender* proxyVPrdr = static_cast<VPRender*>(data);
3512  if (!proxyVPrdr)
3513  return;
3514 
3515  auto vp = proxyVPrdr->vp;
3516  auto cam = proxyVPrdr->renderMgr->getCamera();
3517 
3518  if (cam == nullptr)
3519  Base::Console().DeveloperWarning("ViewProviderSketch", "Camera is nullptr!\n");
3520  else
3521  vp->onCameraChanged(cam);
3522 }
3523 
3524 void ViewProviderSketch::onCameraChanged(SoCamera* cam)
3525 {
3526  auto rotSk = Base::Rotation(getDocument()->getEditingTransform());// sketch orientation
3527  auto rotc = cam->orientation.getValue().getValue();
3528  auto rotCam =
3529  Base::Rotation(rotc[0],
3530  rotc[1],
3531  rotc[2],
3532  rotc[3]);// camera orientation (needed because float to double conversion)
3533 
3534  // Is camera in the same hemisphere as positive sketch normal ?
3535  auto orientation = (rotCam.invert() * rotSk).multVec(Base::Vector3d(0, 0, 1));
3536  auto tmpFactor = orientation.z < 0 ? -1 : 1;
3537 
3538  if (tmpFactor != viewOrientationFactor) {// redraw only if viewing side changed
3539  Base::Console().Log("Switching side, now %s, redrawing\n",
3540  tmpFactor < 0 ? "back" : "front");
3541  viewOrientationFactor = tmpFactor;
3542  draw();
3543 
3544  QString cmdStr = QStringLiteral("ActiveSketch.ViewObject.TempoVis.sketchClipPlane("
3545  "ActiveSketch, ActiveSketch.ViewObject.SectionView, %1)\n")
3546  .arg(tmpFactor < 0 ? QLatin1String("True") : QLatin1String("False"));
3547  Base::Interpreter().runStringObject(cmdStr.toLatin1());
3548  }
3549 
3550  // Stretch the axes to cover the whole viewport.
3551  Gui::View3DInventor* view = qobject_cast<Gui::View3DInventor*>(this->getActiveView());
3552  if (view) {
3553  Base::Placement plc = getEditingPlacement();
3554  const Base::BoundBox2d vpBBox = view->getViewer()
3555  ->getViewportOnXYPlaneOfPlacement(plc);
3556  editCoinManager->updateAxesLength(vpBBox);
3557  }
3558 
3559  drawGrid(true);
3560 }

3595 void ViewProviderSketch::deleteSelected()
3596 {
3597  std::vector<Gui::SelectionObject> selection;
3598  selection = Gui::Selection().getSelectionEx(nullptr, Sketcher::SketchObject::getClassTypeId());
3599 
3600  // only one sketch with its subelements are allowed to be selected
3601  if (selection.size() != 1) {
3602  Base::Console().DeveloperWarning(
3603  "ViewProviderSketch",
3604  "Delete: Selection not restricted to one sketch and its subelements\n");
3605  return;
3606  }
3607 
3608  // get the needed lists and objects
3609  const std::vector<std::string>& SubNames = selection[0].getSubNames();
3610 
3611  if (!SubNames.empty()) {
3612  App::Document* doc = getSketchObject()->getDocument();
3613

3615

3617

3621 
3622 bool ViewProviderSketch::onDelete(const std::vector<std::string>& subList)
3623 {
3624  if (isInEditMode()) {
3625  std::vector<std::string> SubNames = subList;
3626 
3627  Gui::Selection().clearSelection();
3628  resetPreselectPoint();
3629 
3630  std::set<int> delInternalGeometries, delExternalGeometries, delCoincidents, delConstraints;
3631  // go through the selected subelements
3632  for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it = SubNames.begin(); it != SubNames.end();
3633  ++it) {
3634  if (it->size() > 4 && it->substr(0, 4) == "Edge") {
3635  int GeoId = std::atoi(it->substr(4, 4000).c_str()) - 1;
3636  if (GeoId >= 0) {
3637  delInternalGeometries.insert(GeoId);
3638  }
3639  else
3640  delExternalGeometries.insert(Sketcher::GeoEnum::RefExt - GeoId);
3641  }
3642  else if (it->size() > 12 && it->substr(0, 12) == "ExternalEdge") {
3643  int GeoId = std::atoi(it->substr(12, 4000).c_str()) - 1;
3644  delExternalGeometries.insert(GeoId);
3645  }
3646  else if (it->size() > 6 && it->substr(0, 6) == "Vertex") {
3647  int VtId = std::atoi(it->substr(6, 4000).c_str()) - 1;
3648  int GeoId;
3649  Sketcher::PointPos PosId;
3650  getSketchObject()->getGeoVertexIndex(VtId, GeoId, PosId);
3651  if (getSketchObject()->getGeometry(GeoId)->is<Part::GeomPoint>()) {
3652  if (GeoId >= 0)
3653  delInternalGeometries.insert(GeoId);
3654  else
3655  delExternalGeometries.insert(Sketcher::GeoEnum::RefExt - GeoId);
3656  }
3657  else
3658  delCoincidents.insert(VtId);
3659  }
3660  else if (*it == "RootPoint") {
3661  delCoincidents.insert(Sketcher::GeoEnum::RtPnt);
3662  }
3663  else if (it->size() > 10 && it->substr(0, 10) == "Constraint") {
3664  int ConstrId = Sketcher::PropertyConstraintList::getIndexFromConstraintName(*it);
3665  delConstraints.insert(ConstrId);
3666  }
3667  }
3668 
3669  // We stored the vertices, but is there really a coincident constraint? Check
3670  const std::vector<Sketcher::Constraint*>& vals = getSketchObject()->Constraints.getValues();
3671 
3672  std::set<int>::const_reverse_iterator rit;
3673 
3674  for (rit = delConstraints.rbegin(); rit != delConstraints.rend(); ++rit) {
3675  try {
3676  Gui::cmdAppObjectArgs(getObject(), "delConstraint(%d)", *rit);
3677  }
3678  catch (const Base::Exception& e) {
3679  Base::Console().DeveloperError("ViewProviderSketch", "%s\n", e.what());
3680  }
3681  }
3682 
3683  for (rit = delCoincidents.rbegin(); rit != delCoincidents.rend(); ++rit) {
3684  int GeoId;
3685  PointPos PosId;
3686 
3687  if (*rit == GeoEnum::RtPnt) {// RootPoint
3688  GeoId = Sketcher::GeoEnum::RtPnt;
3689  PosId = Sketcher::PointPos::start;
3690  }
3691  else {
3692  getSketchObject()->getGeoVertexIndex(*rit, GeoId, PosId);
3693  }
3694 
3695  if (GeoId != GeoEnum::GeoUndef) {
3696  for (std::vector<Sketcher::Constraint*>::const_iterator it = vals.begin();
3697  it != vals.end();
3698  ++it) {
3699  if (((*it)->Type == Sketcher::Coincident)
3700  && (((*it)->First == GeoId && (*it)->FirstPos == PosId)
3701  || ((*it)->Second == GeoId && (*it)->SecondPos == PosId))) {
3702  try {
3703  Gui::cmdAppObjectArgs(
3704  getObject(), "delConstraintOnPoint(%d,%d)", GeoId, (int)PosId);
3705  }
3706  catch (const Base::Exception& e) {
3707  Base::Console().DeveloperError("ViewProviderSketch", "%s\n", e.what());
3708  }
3709  break;
3710  }
3711  }
3712  }
3713  }
3714 
3715  if (!delInternalGeometries.empty()) {
3716  std::stringstream stream;
3717 
3718  // NOTE: SketchObject delGeometries will sort the array, so filling it here with a
3719  // reverse iterator would lead to the worst case scenario for sorting.
3720  auto endit = std::prev(delInternalGeometries.end());
3721  for (auto it = delInternalGeometries.begin(); it != endit; ++it) {
3722  stream << *it << ",";
3723  }
3724 
3725  stream << *endit;
3726 
3727  try {
3728  Gui::cmdAppObjectArgs(getObject(), "delGeometries([%s])", stream.str().c_str());
3729  }
3730  catch (const Base::Exception& e) {
3731  Base::Console().DeveloperError("ViewProviderSketch", "%s\n", e.what());
3732  }
3733 
3734  stream.str(std::string());
3735  }
3736 
3737  for (rit = delExternalGeometries.rbegin(); rit != delExternalGeometries.rend(); ++rit) {
3738  try {
3739  Gui::cmdAppObjectArgs(getObject(), "delExternal(%d)", *rit);
3740  }
3741  catch (const Base::Exception& e) {
3742  Base::Console().DeveloperError("ViewProviderSketch", "%s\n", e.what());
3743  }
3744  }
3745 
3746  int ret = getSketchObject()->solve();
3747 
3748  if (ret != 0) {
3749  // if the sketched could not be solved, we first redraw to update the UI geometry as
3750  // onChanged did not update it.
3751  UpdateSolverInformation();
3752  draw(false, true);
3753 
3754  signalConstraintsChanged();
3755  signalElementsChanged();
3756  }
3757 
3758  // Notes on solving and recomputing:
3759  //
3760  // This function is generally called from StdCmdDelete::activated
3761  // Since 2015-05-03 that function includes a recompute at the end.
3762 
3763  // Since December 2018, the function is no longer called from StdCmdDelete::activated,
3764  // as there is an event filter installed that intercepts the del key event. So now we do
3765  // need to tidy up after ourselves again.
3766 
3767  if (viewProviderParameters.autoRecompute) {
3768  Gui::Command::updateActive();
3769  }
3770  else {
3771  editCoinManager->drawConstraintIcons();
3772  this->updateColor();
3773  }
3774 
3775  // if in edit not delete the object
3776  return false;
3777  }
3778  // if not in edit delete the whole object
3779  return PartGui::ViewProviderPart::onDelete(subList);
3780 }

3788  mergedicon = Gui::BitmapFactoryInst::mergePixmap(
3789  mergedicon, px, Gui::BitmapFactoryInst::BottomRight);
3790  }

3953 
3954 SbVec2f ViewProviderSketch::getScreenCoordinates(SbVec2f sketchcoordinates) const
3955 {
3956 
3957  Base::Placement sketchPlacement = getEditingPlacement();
3958  Base::Vector3d sketchPos(sketchPlacement.getPosition());
3959  Base::Rotation sketchRot(sketchPlacement.getRotation());
3960 
3961  // get global coordinates from sketcher coordinates
3962  Base::Vector3d pos(sketchcoordinates[0], sketchcoordinates[1], 0);
3963  sketchRot.multVec(pos, pos);
3964  pos = pos + sketchPos;
3965 
3966  Gui::MDIView* mdi = this->getActiveView();
3967  Gui::View3DInventor* view = qobject_cast<Gui::View3DInventor*>(mdi);
3968  if (!view || !isInEditMode())
3969  return SbVec2f(0, 0);
3970 
3971  Gui::View3DInventorViewer* viewer = view->getViewer();
3972 
3973  SoCamera* pCam = viewer->getSoRenderManager()->getCamera();
3974 
3975  if (!pCam)
3976  return SbVec2f(0, 0);
3977 
3978  SbViewVolume vol = pCam->getViewVolume();
3979  Gui::ViewVolumeProjection proj(vol);
3980 
3981  // dimensionless [0 1] (or 1.5 see View3DInventorViewer.cpp )
3982  Base::Vector3d screencoords = proj(pos);
3983 
3984  int width = viewer->getGLWidget()->width(), height = viewer->getGLWidget()->height();
3985 
3986  if (width >= height) {
3987  // "Landscape" orientation, to square
3988  screencoords.x *= height;
3989  screencoords.x += (width - height) / 2.0;
3990  screencoords.y *= height;
3991  }
3992  else {
3993  // "Portrait" orientation
3994  screencoords.x *= width;
3995  screencoords.y *= width;
3996  screencoords.y += (height - width) / 2.0;
3997  }
3998 
3999  SbVec2f iconCoords(screencoords.x, screencoords.y);
4000 
4001  return iconCoords;
4002 }

4025 double ViewProviderSketch::getRotation(SbVec3f pos0, SbVec3f pos1) const
4026 {
4027  double x0, y0, x1, y1;
4028 
4029  Gui::MDIView* mdi =
4030  Gui::Application::Instance->editViewOfNode(editCoinManager->getRootEditNode());
4031  if (!(mdi && mdi->isDerivedFrom(Gui::View3DInventor::getClassTypeId())))
4032  return 0;
4033  Gui::View3DInventorViewer* viewer = static_cast<Gui::View3DInventor*>(mdi)->getViewer();
4034  SoCamera* pCam = viewer->getSoRenderManager()->getCamera();
4035  if (!pCam)
4036  return 0;
4037 
4038  try {
4039  SbViewVolume vol = pCam->getViewVolume();
4040 
4041  getCoordsOnSketchPlane(pos0, vol.getProjectionDirection(), x0, y0);
4042  getCoordsOnSketchPlane(pos1, vol.getProjectionDirection(), x1, y1);
4043 
4044  return -atan2((y1 - y0), (x1 - x0)) * 180 / M_PI;
4045  }
4046  catch (const Base::ZeroDivisionError&) {
4047  return 0;
4048  }
4049 }

4117 void ViewProviderSketch::generateContextMenu()
4118 {
4119  int selectedEdges = 0;
4120  int selectedLines = 0;
4121  int selectedConics = 0;
4122  int selectedPoints = 0;
4123  int selectedConstraints = 0;
4124  int selectedBsplines = 0;
4125  int selectedBsplineKnots = 0;
4126  int selectedOrigin = 0;
4127  int selectedEndPoints = 0;
4128  bool onlyOrigin = false;
4129 
4130  Gui::MenuItem menu;
4131  menu.setCommand("Sketcher context");
4132 
4133  std::vector<Gui::SelectionObject> selection =
4134  Gui::Selection().getSelectionEx(0, Sketcher::SketchObject::getClassTypeId());
4135 
4136  // if something is selected, count different elements in the current selection
4137  if (selection.size() > 0) {
4138  const std::vector<std::string> SubNames = selection[0].getSubNames();
4139  const Sketcher::SketchObject* obj;
4140  if (selection[0].getObject()->isDerivedFrom<Sketcher::SketchObject>()) {
4141  obj = static_cast<Sketcher::SketchObject*>(selection[0].getObject());
4142  for (auto& name : SubNames) {
4143  int geoId = std::atoi(name.substr(4, 4000).c_str()) - 1;
4144  const Part::Geometry* geo = getSketchObject()->getGeometry(geoId);
4145  if (name.substr(0, 4) == "Edge" || name.substr(0, 12) == "ExternalEdge") {
4146  ++selectedEdges;
4147 
4148  if (geoId >= 0) {
4149  if (isLineSegment(*geo)) {
4150  ++selectedLines;
4151  }
4152  else if (geo->is<Part::GeomBSplineCurve>()) {
4153  ++selectedBsplines;
4154  }
4155  else {
4156  ++selectedConics;
4157  }
4158  }
4159  }
4160  else if (name.substr(0, 4) == "Vert") {
4161  ++selectedPoints;
4162  Sketcher::PointPos posId;
4163  getIdsFromName(name, obj, geoId, posId);
4164  if (isBsplineKnotOrEndPoint(obj, geoId, posId)) {
4165  ++selectedBsplineKnots;
4166  }
4167 
4168  ++selectedEndPoints;
4169  }
4170  else if (name.substr(0, 4) == "Cons") {
4171  ++selectedConstraints;
4172  }
4173  else if (name.substr(2, 5) == "Axis") {
4174  ++selectedEdges;
4175  ++selectedLines;
4176  ++selectedOrigin;
4177  }
4178  else if (name.substr(0, 4) == "Root") {
4179  ++selectedPoints;
4180  ++selectedOrigin;
4181  }
4182  }
4183  }
4184  if (selectedPoints + selectedEdges == selectedOrigin) {
4185  onlyOrigin = true;
4186  }
4187  // build context menu items depending on the selection
4188  if (selectedBsplines > 0 && selectedBsplines == selectedEdges && selectedPoints == 0
4189  && !onlyOrigin) {
4190  menu << "Sketcher_BSplineInsertKnot"
4191  << "Sketcher_BSplineIncreaseDegree"
4192  << "Sketcher_BSplineDecreaseDegree";
4193  }
4194  else if (selectedBsplineKnots > 0 && selectedBsplineKnots == selectedPoints
4195  && selectedEdges == 0 && !onlyOrigin) {
4196  if (selectedBsplineKnots == 1) {
4197  menu << "Sketcher_BSplineIncreaseKnotMultiplicity"
4198  << "Sketcher_BSplineDecreaseKnotMultiplicity";
4199  }
4200  }
4201  if (selectedEdges >= 1 && selectedPoints == 0 && selectedBsplines == 0 && !onlyOrigin) {
4202  menu << "Sketcher_Dimension";
4203  if (selectedConics == 0) {
4204  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainHorVer"
4205  << "Sketcher_ConstrainHorizontal"
4206  << "Sketcher_ConstrainVertical";
4207 
4208  if (selectedLines > 1) {
4209  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainParallel";
4210 
4211  if (selectedLines == 2) {
4212  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainPerpendicular"
4213  << "Sketcher_ConstrainTangent";
4214  }
4215 
4216  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainEqual";
4217  }
4218  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainBlock";
4219  }
4220  else if (selectedConics > 1 && selectedLines == 0) {
4221  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainCoincidentUnified"
4222  << "Sketcher_ConstrainTangent"
4223  << "Sketcher_ConstrainEqual";
4224  }
4225  else if (selectedConics == 1 && selectedLines == 1) {
4226  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainPerpendicular"
4227  << "Sketcher_ConstrainTangent";
4228  }
4229  }
4230  else if (selectedEdges == 1 && selectedPoints >= 1 && !onlyOrigin) {
4231  menu << "Sketcher_Dimension";
4232  if (selectedConics == 0 && selectedBsplines == 0) {
4233  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainCoincidentUnified"
4234  << "Sketcher_ConstrainHorVer"
4235  << "Sketcher_ConstrainHorizontal"
4236  << "Sketcher_ConstrainVertical";
4237  if (selectedPoints == 2) {
4238  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainSymmetric";
4239  }
4240  if (selectedPoints == 1) {
4241  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainPerpendicular"
4242  << "Sketcher_ConstrainTangent"
4243  << "Sketcher_ConstrainSymmetric";
4244  }
4245  }
4246  else {
4247  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainCoincidentUnified"
4248  << "Sketcher_ConstrainPerpendicular"
4249  << "Sketcher_ConstrainTangent";
4250  }
4251  }
4252  else if (selectedEdges == 0 && selectedPoints >= 1 && !onlyOrigin) {
4253  menu << "Sketcher_Dimension";
4254 
4255  if (selectedPoints > 1) {
4256  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainCoincidentUnified"
4257  << "Sketcher_ConstrainHorVer"
4258  << "Sketcher_ConstrainHorizontal"
4259  << "Sketcher_ConstrainVertical";
4260  }
4261  if (selectedPoints == 2) {
4262  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainPerpendicular"
4263  << "Sketcher_ConstrainTangent";
4264  if (selectedEndPoints == 2) {
4265  menu << "Sketcher_JoinCurves";
4266  }
4267  }
4268  if (selectedPoints == 3) {
4269  menu << "Sketcher_ConstrainSymmetric";
4270  }
4271  }

4373 void ViewProviderSketch::preselectToSelection(const std::stringstream& ss,
